task.title: Create a classification rule set
task.shortdesc: Steps that describe how to name a classification rule set and apply the variable.

step.cmd: (Prerequisite) Define the classification structure in Admin Tools > Report Suites.

info.p: Variables will display in the New Rule Set panel only after they have at least one classification defined for that variable.

You can create classifications on a variable in Admin > Report Suites > Traffic > Traffic Classifications (or Conversion > Conversion Classifications). Then select the variable, then click Add Classification.
See Classifications in Admin Tools help on adding classifications.

step.cmd: To create the rule set, click Admin ToolsClassification Rule Builder.

stepresult.p: If this is the first time accessing the rule builder, the Available Report Suites page displays.
Select one or more available report suites to use.
See the definitions for the Classification Rule Builder page for more information about this feature.

step.cmd: On the Classification Rule Builder page, click Add Rule Set.
On New Rule Set, type a rule set name and select a variable from the list.

stepresult.p: The Select Variable list is populated with all classified variables available in all the report suites in your log-in company. A single variable in a report suite can belong to only one rule set.
See Variable in the definitions for the Classification Rule Builder page for more information.
The rule is displayed on the Classification Rule Builder page.

step.cmd: Continue by adding classification rules to the set.
